item.title: Report E-2025020234
item.description:
Report E-2025020234

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-19T06:18:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-14
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On February 14, 2025, one (1) 1-gallon jug of UN1789 was punctured and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel utilized hand tools, absorbents, and a neutralizing agent to remediate the UN1789-impacted loading dock floor. All impacted material was collected and containerized into two (2) 35-gallon drums and staged onsite.

item.title: Report E-2025020105
item.description:
Report E-2025020105

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-15T03:17:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-10
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On February 10, 2025, two (2) 55-gallon drums of UN2922 had loose lids and leaked approximately two (2) ounces of product to the outside of the drums. R+L retained Cura Emergency Services who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE). TLE personnel overpacked the damaged drums into two (2) 85-gallon overpacks.
